meanings.definition: A quantum of vibrational energy in a crystal lattice.
meanings.sent1: The scientist explained how phonons are like tiny packets of energy in a crystal lattice.
meanings.sent2: In the lab, researchers studied the behavior of phonons in different types of materials.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous phonons in the crystal lattice decided to play a game of hide-and-seek with the atoms.
meanings.sent4: The phonons danced through the crystal lattice, spreading warmth and energy wherever they went.
meanings.sent5: As the crystal lattice vibrated with phonons, it seemed like a symphony of energy and motion.

meanings.definition: A collective excitation in a periodic, elastic arrangement of atoms or molecules in condensed matter, like solids and some liquids.
meanings.sent1: The textbook described how phonons can travel through a solid material, carrying energy with them.
meanings.sent2: Scientists observed the movement of phonons in the condensed matter to understand its properties.
meanings.sent3: The phonons in the elastic arrangement decided to have a race to see who could travel the fastest.
meanings.sent4: As the phonons moved through the material, it was as if a wave of energy was passing through.
meanings.sent5: The presence of phonons in the condensed matter created a ripple effect of vibrations and energy.
